claims.claim: The global AI agent market is valued at $7.38-7.92 billion in 2025
claims.verification_notes: Multiple market research firms (Grand View, MarketsandMarkets, Precedence Research, Index.dev) cluster estimates between $7.38-7.92B. One outlier (LitsLink) claims $150B but appears unreliable.

claims.claim: Long-term market projections vary dramatically: $50B to $236B by 2030-2034
claims.verification_notes: Sources disagree significantly on long-term projections. Range is nearly 5x between lowest and highest estimates. Treat any specific projection with caution.

claims.claim: 85% of organizations plan to adopt AI agents by end of 2025
claims.verification_notes: This is a PROJECTION, not current adoption. McKinsey shows actual deployment at 23% scaling + 39% experimenting = 62% engaged. Survey methodology unclear. Actual adoption likely lower than 85%.

claims.claim: Organizations project average ROI of 171% from agentic AI deployments
claims.verification_notes: This is PROJECTED ROI, not realized. Critical context: 95% of AI pilots fail to deliver measurable returns (MIT study), 80% of AI projects fail (RAND). Actual ROI likely far lower than expectations.

claims.claim: 70-95% of enterprise AI projects fail to deliver measurable ROI
claims.verification_notes: Multiple credible sources (MIT, RAND, BCG) confirm high failure rates. MIT specifically notes 95% of AI pilots fail. This contradicts optimistic ROI projections.

claims.claim: MCP was donated to Agentic AI Foundation under Linux Foundation in December 2025
claims.verification_notes: Confirmed by multiple news sources and Wikipedia. Co-founders: Anthropic, Block, OpenAI.

claims.claim: MCP has significant security vulnerabilities including prompt injection, tool mutation, and data exfiltration risks
claims.verification_notes: Multiple security researchers (Simon Willison, Red Hat, Microsoft, Pillar Security) have documented MCP vulnerabilities. MCP team acknowledges these in specification.

claims.claim: AgentCore SDK downloaded over 2 million times in 5 months since preview
claims.verification_notes: Official AWS blog statement. Self-reported but credible source.

claims.claim: 80% of organizations have encountered risky behaviors from AI agents
claims.verification_notes: Survey-based, Palo Alto Networks research. Methodology not fully transparent.

claims.claim: OpenAI launched AgentKit at Dev Day on October 6, 2025
claims.verification_notes: Official announcement, widely reported across tech media.

claims.claim: Claude Agent SDK published on September 29, 2025
claims.verification_notes: Official Anthropic documentation.

claims.claim: LangChain main repository has ~122,000 GitHub stars as of December 2025
claims.verification_notes: Verified via GitHub. Previously reported lower numbers (~70K in July 2025) showing rapid growth.

claims.claim: CrewAI has over 40,000 GitHub stars with 1.8M+ monthly downloads
claims.verification_notes: Official CrewAI announcement (Oct 2025) confirms 40K stars. Previous claim of 30K was an underestimate.

claims.claim: LangGraph has over 22,000 stars and 4.2 million monthly downloads
claims.verification_notes: GitHub metrics publicly verifiable. Download stats from package managers.

claims.claim: Enterprise AI agent implementations range from $100,000-$2,000,000 depending on scope
claims.verification_notes: Consistent with multiple enterprise software implementation benchmarks across sources.

claims.claim: AI agent costs have decreased to under $0.50 per interaction vs $4-8 for human agents
claims.verification_notes: Depends heavily on use case complexity, implementation quality, and interaction type. General benchmark only.

claims.claim: Salesforce charges $2 per conversation for AI agents
claims.verification_notes: Public pricing information from Salesforce Agentforce.

claims.claim: Gartner predicts by 2028, 33% of enterprise software will incorporate agentic AI
claims.verification_notes: Official Gartner forecast, widely cited in industry reports.

claims.claim: 92% of developers now use AI tools, with 30% productivity boost reported
claims.verification_notes: GitHub Octoverse 2025 data. Self-reported productivity gains may be inflated.

claims.claim: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore reached general availability in late 2025
claims.verification_notes: Official AWS announcement confirmed GA status.

claims.claim: OpenAI adopted MCP in March 2025, Google confirmed support in April 2025
claims.verification_notes: Official announcements from both companies, widely reported.

claims.claim: LangChain faces significant developer criticism for over-abstraction, dependency bloat, and instability
claims.verification_notes: Consistent criticism across multiple independent community sources (HN, Medium, tech blogs). Pattern clear despite anecdotal nature.

claims.claim: AWS Bedrock Agents/AgentCore has significant developer experience challenges including CLI issues, IAM complexity, and debugging difficulties
claims.verification_notes: Multiple independent developer reports confirm pain points. AWS acknowledged challenges in AgentCore updates.

key_corrections: CrewAI has 40K+ stars, not 30K as initially reported
85% adoption is a projection, not current state (actual ~62%)
171% ROI is projected expectation; 95% of AI pilots fail to deliver ROI
MCP has documented security vulnerabilities that should be highlighted
